Record date: 2084-08-23
Follow-up for labile hypertension. At the time of our last visit, she
began Procardia XL 30 mg daily and completed a series of 24 hour urine
tests. All of the urine tests returned normal. After being on the dose
of Procardia, she noticed some continuation of her symptoms and Dr. Iniguez
suggested that she increase the dose to two tablets daily. She has been
on that dose for the last two weeks and has noticed dramatic change in
her symptoms. Shes having much fewer spells and her blood pressure,
likewise is much lower than it had been. Overall, she is pleased with
these results.
Her other medications have remained the same although she has
discontinued using immediate release Nifedipine and Nitroglycerin both
sublingual and patches.
BP initially 142/52, later by me 170/68
Weight 155 lbs.
Pulse 68
Her examination remains unchanged except she has 2+ edema in her left
leg and 1+ in the right leg.
Assessment: Labile hypertension-clinically improved.
Plan:
1. Change Procardia XL to 60 mg once daily and continue other
medications as is.
2. I suggested that she return for her regular follow-up with Dr. Gibbons
and Dr. Iniguez. I would be happy to see her in the future but do not
feel that additional visits here are necessary.
